meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel distressed or discouraged.
meanings.sent1: The news of the canceled event dismayed the attendees.
meanings.sent2: She was dismayed to find out her flight was delayed.
meanings.sent3: The cat's dismayed expression when it saw the empty food bowl was priceless.
meanings.sent4: The sudden rain dismayed the picnic plans.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's stern look dismayed the misbehaving students.

meanings.sent1: He had a dismayed look on his face after failing the test.
meanings.sent2: The team felt dismayed after losing the championship game.
meanings.sent3: The dismayed puppy whined when its favorite toy was taken away.
meanings.sent4: Her dismayed expression mirrored her disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The child's dismayed reaction to the broken toy was heart-wrenching.
